name: df-lplanes
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(clpl, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(clln, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s2), cfv(ccvr, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ LPlanes =(s0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { s1 ∈(Base ` s0)| ∃(s2 ∈(LLines ` s0), s2[(<o ` s0)]s1)})
comment: Define the set of all "lattice planes" (lattice elements which cover a line) in a Hilbert lattice ` k ` , in other words all elements of height 3 (or lattice dimension 3 or projective dimension 2). (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)
